sentences.english: The survey said the average annual first-team wage at Barcelona was ￡4.94m.
sentences.chinese: 巴薩先發陣容球員平均年薪爲494萬英鎊。

sentences.english: How many is yearly salary of Chinese basketball chief coach Younasi?
sentences.chinese: 中國籃球主教練尤納斯的年薪是多少？

sentences.english: He has money to burn; his yearly salary is in seven digits veduchina.
sentences.chinese: 他錢多的象水一樣，他的年薪是七位數。

sentences.english: This was a six-figure job, after all.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個年薪六位數的工作。

sentences.english: Some of them will still make millions to spend their lives on a bench.
sentences.chinese: 很多人還是會拿着百萬年薪坐在板凳席上。

sentences.english: His annual salary is sixty-five thousand dollars.
sentences.chinese: 他的年薪是六千五百美元。

sentences.english: Archivists make an average annual salary of $50,810.
sentences.chinese: 檔案保管員的平均年薪是50，810美元。

sentences.english: This isn't the first time an auto executive has volunteered to work for a token salary.
sentences.chinese: 其實，汽車公司老總自願拿象徵性的年薪並非首次。

sentences.english: In our country, implementing annual salary system is inevitable requirement for the market economy development.
sentences.chinese: 在我國，實行年薪制是市場經濟發展的必然要求。

sentences.english: What's more, none have an annual salary above $40, 000.
sentences.chinese: 還有，沒有一個職位超過了4萬美元的年薪。

sentences.english: Funeral service managers make an average annual salary of $79,930.
sentences.chinese: 葬禮服務經理的平均年薪是79，930美元。

sentences.english: The position of director of sleep pays a salary of ￡60, 000 ayear.
sentences.chinese: 這一職位的年薪是6萬英鎊。

sentences.english: The main point discussed is the Year salary system and the Executive stock option system.
sentences.chinese: 重點論述了經營者年薪制和經營者股票期權制。

sentences.english: Would you accept an offer of $25,000 a year?
sentences.chinese: 你能接受年薪兩萬五千嗎？

sentences.english: They can come out and demand a salary of $60, 000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 他們能揚名於世，並可要求6萬美元的年薪。

definition: social status/price of a slave/price of a person (a sportsman etc)/worth/value (of stocks, valuables etc)
